page.title: 02BALLATER: ROYAL CONNECTIONS
page.content: 'Royal' Deeside became a great attraction for Victorians who came initially by horse and carriage and then by train. The local population would turn out in force to welcome the Royal visitors and their guests. The Royal Family continue its connections with the area. Many of the local traders hold Royal Warrants for goods and services supplied to members of the Royal Family. Tourists to Deeside travelling now in cars, coaches and caravans flock to the area particularly during August, when the Queen is at Balmoral for her annual holiday. Ballater is the centre for these visitors and has many hotels, guesthouses, summer homes and a busy caravan park.
